channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Reconfigurable single-walled carbon nanotube ferroelectric field-effect transistors
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 17 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62827-2

Rhee et al. report scalable reconfigurable carbon nanotube transistors with a ferroelectric aluminum scandium nitride gate dielectric. They show balanced ambipolar currents, strong memory retention, and enable ternary content-addressable memory with fewer devices than traditional silicon circuits.
item.dc:title: Reconfigurable single-walled carbon nanotube ferroelectric field-effect transistors
item.dc:creator: Dongjoon Rhee
Kwan-Ho Kim
Jeffrey Zheng
Seunguk Song
Lian-Mao Peng
Roy H. Olsson III
Joohoon Kang
Deep Jariwala

item.title: Long-range order enhance performance of patterned blue quantum dot light-emitting diodes
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62345-1

Jia et al. report an aromatic ligand to regulate the interparticle interaction of blue colloidal quantum dots. Combined with using micropillar templates to segment liquid film, long-range ordered quantum dot array is formed, enabling an efficiency of 18.3% with pixel size of 3 µm for blue LEDs.
item.dc:title: Long-range order enhance performance of patterned blue quantum dot light-emitting diodes
item.dc:creator: Yuyu Jia
Hui Li
Ning Guo
Fengmian Li
Tianchen Li
Haoran Ma
Yuyan Zhao
Hanfei Gao
Dan Wang
Jiangang Feng
Zhiyuan He
Lei Jiang
Yuchen Wu

item.title: Ultrahigh thermoelectricity obtained in classical BiSbTe alloy processed under super-gravity
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 16 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62611-2

The authors develop a super-gravity field remelting fabrication technology which is effective in synergistically optimizing the electrical and thermal transport properties. Under a super-gravity field, the brittle (Bi,Sb)2Te3 alloy undergoes unusual plastic deformation during melt solidification.
item.dc:title: Ultrahigh thermoelectricity obtained in classical BiSbTe alloy processed under super-gravity
item.dc:creator: Min Zhou
Haojian Su
